titleStmt.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Harold B. Clingerman, November 29, 1972
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, John Gneisenau, 1881-1973

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Neihardt, John Gneisenau, 1881-1973
bibl.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Harold B. Clingerman

keywords.term: All is but a beginning : youth remembered, 1881-1901

revisionDesc.change: Weakly, Laura K. Added keywords and correspDesc

div1.p: I was very glad to hear from you for I do not forget your encouraging interest in my work and I am greatly pleased to hear that you liked my latest book, ALL IS BUT A BEGINNING.

I think it will interest you to know that a special writer for the Saturday Review of the Arts interviewed me a month ofor so ago for an article which will appear in the Review in February. I am told that advance copies will be available in January.

You will note that ALL IS BUT A BEGINNING is now a best seller. Also, BLACK ELK SPEAKS continues its good work throughout the country and even a half dozen countries of Europe. It's hard to believe that there are two best sellers at the same time.
Is it likely that we may meet before too long and have a chat about this and that.

closer.salute: With every kind thought, your friend

postscript.p: The enclosed bookplate is for your copy of ALL IS BUT A BEGINNING
